p: The anti-elastase activity of Plectranthus spp. extracts and isolated compounds was evaluated in vitro using SANA as substrate and detecting the formation of p-nitroaniline at 405 nm resulting from SANA hydrolysis, as described in the Materials and Methods - Anti-elastase Activity Assay, using ursolic acid as positive control. Results of the enzymatic assay concerning the organic extracts from Plectranthus spp. plants are expressed in Figure 6(A), revealing in general very weak elastase inhibitory activity.
